alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Telfair; Wilcox (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 9:22PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Abbeville affecting Dodge, Wilcox and Telfair Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Abbeville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to begin late tonight. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Abbeville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Between 10 and 12 feet, Bankfull conditions begin upstream and downstream from the gage at Highway 286. Water begins to spill out into low lying areas of the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecasted to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 12.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.4 feet on 03/04/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
